intro: Leptolobium tortum, commonly known as the twisted-leaved leptolobium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, twisted leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
